title: Can gravity simply be the surface of the Earth accelerating upwards due the expanding universe? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: Can gravity simply be the surface of the Earth accelerating upwards due the expanding universe? No. It can’t. The math wouldn’t come anywhere close to working out, for one thing, the the expansion of the universe doesn’t affect gravitationally bound matter like the Earth for another. Here’s what gravity seems to be, at least in the Einsteinian view: Matter warps spacetime—notice, I didn’t say space, but spacetime—in a direction you can’t see or really imagine. When people show the curvature of space by placing a bowling ball on a bedspread, you are right not to get it. That’s wrong. That’s not it at all. Matter curves spacetime—such that our forward motion through time no longer carries us straight through space. When we are at rest, say sitting in a beach chair on Earth, we are not really at rest, we are moving forward through time at the speed of light—but spacetime is curved in such a way that “forward” through time curves “down” through space toward the nearby mass. To sitting in our chair, sipping a drink, watching the waves, we careen “down” through spacetime toward the Earth—but our electrons can’t get through its electrons, so we stop—moving through space. But now the Earth is pushing us perpetually in a curved path through time, and motion along a curve is acceleration, which is why we experience gravity as an acceleration.

You are conflating 2 well known cosmological phenomena: gravity and the expansion of the Universe. Mass causes gravity and it only goes one way, so more mass attracts more mass, like the Earth. The Earth is in orbit around a much larger mass called the Sun, otherwise we would fall into it. Likewise, the Moon is orbiting the Earth without falling onto us. You can do a simple calculation using Newton’s formula for gravity and the formula for centrifugal force to work out that they are perfectly balanced. However, notice the Moon rotates once with every revolution of Earth. This is because tidal effects from Earth’s gravity gradually slowed it down till it only had one side facing the Earth at all times. Likewise the Sun is slowing the Earth’s rotation down and has done to Mercury what Earth has done to the Moon. But the Moon’s gravity creates tides on Earth and that means it is slowing down in its orbit and slowly moving away. None of this has anything to do with the expansion of the Universe, which is a consequence of the aftermath of inflation (according to current theories) following the Big Bang. Evidence for this is in the Cosmological Background Radiation. Recently, we’ve discovered that the Universe’s expansion is accelerating, which we’ve enigmatically called ‘Dark Energy’. I’m not sure if that has satisfactorily answered your question, but the ‘surface of the Earth’ is not accelerating upwards at all.

No, it can’t. If it were, you’d find the same strength of gravity at the tops of mountains as what you find at sea level. In fact, the strength of gravity varies by altitude - and those differences are measurable. The results are completely consistent with the “mass and energy curve space and time” model of gravity, and irreconcilably inconsistent with the “expanding earth” model of gravity. And note that the “flat earth accelerating upwards at 1G” model is also ruled out by this same experiment.

No. Gravity is the attraction that all bodies of mass have to one another. We have performed experiments to measure the universal force of gravitational attraction using objects here on Earth. All observable celestial bodies appear to follow a set pattern if behavior which is only explainable through gravity functioning under the current model which is taught and accepted by the scientific community.

you’re more right than you think. motion or angular momentum are exactly (mathematically) the measurements of gravity. You can be weightless via motion in a gravitational field. We’re not floating in space because the earth has enough mass to keep us planted. If you were to get in a spaceship and go up 7 miles a second, you’d have as much measurable gravity then the entire earth. Remember, Einstein and pals just showed us, very precisely, the effects of gravity. The actual cause, the jury is still out.
